issue.title: [CF 972] Icon Activation Border buggy since latest beta build
issue.body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Create an icon with Notification Animation Icon: Activation Border
2. Whenever the conditions are met the Activation Border will trigger in a buggy way
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
Expected is normal Blizzard-like Activation Border. Instead the effect appears to "double" in a way - border lights up as expected but also a magnified overlay of the effect appears for ~0.2sec that is distracting and obstructive. This effect also seems to trigger on "Always Hidden" icons for no apparent reason.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
Only happens since build 7.0.2-7-gc44ba28 (build that included the following in changelog "TellMeWhen now duplicates Blizzard's code for the spell activation overlay (and has some additional code to get this to play nicely with Masque) so that it should hopefully no longer get blamed for tainting your action bars.")

Do you have an error log of what happened?
NA

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)
NA

Quote:

the effect appears to "double" in a way - border lights up as expected but also a magnified overlay of the effect appears for 0.2sec that is distracting and obstructive.

I should add that, if I am understanding what you're describing correctly, this is part of the effect provided by Blizzard, and it always has been. It starts big and then shrinks to fit the size of the icon. Perhaps you had another addon that was modifying the Blizzard version of the effect.

Edited Jul 21, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Yes, this is indeed the Blizzard effect (starts zoomed, then zooms in on the icon).
I've confirmed that this issue happens with all other addons disabled.
After looking into this a bit more, it seems that the issue only happens if the effect is fired when it is already used on at least one other icon. The first time animation will be correct and smooth while on subsequent icons the animation will be buggy. I've attached a screenshot of how the buggy animation looks in the middle of firing.
Created a profile that consists of 2 icons which check target range and fire animation when getting 10yds or nearer and 11yds or nearer respectively. So simply approaching target at steady speed should show the bug.
